verses.roman:
nānā-puṣpodyāne tathā khele rātri-dine
lakṣmīdevīre saṅge nāhi laya ki kāraṇe?

synonyms: nānā-puṣpa-udyāne—in the various flower gardens; tathā—there; khele—He plays; rātri-dine—both day and night; lakṣmī-devīre—Lakṣmīdevī, the goddess of fortune; saṅge—with Him; nāhi—does not; laya—take; ki kāraṇe—what is the reason.
translation: "The Lord enjoys His pastimes day and night in various flower gardens there. But why did He not take Lakṣmīdevī, the goddess of fortune, with Him?"
